MIDIMessageEvent.summary: The MIDIMessageEvent interface of the Web MIDI API represents the event passed to the event of the interface. A midimessage event is fired every time a MIDI message is sent from a device represented by a , for example when a MIDI keyboard key is pressed, a knob is tweaked, or a slider is moved.

MIDIMessageEventMIDIMessageEvent.summary: The MIDIMessageEvent() constructor creates a new object. Typically this constructor is not used as events are created when a finishes receiving one or more MIDI messages.

MIDIMessageEventData.summary: The data read-only property of the interface returns the MIDI data bytes of a single MIDI message.
